etymology.value: Past participle of the Italian verb 'spendere' (to spend).

usage_notes.explanation: 'Speso' is the masculine singular form of the past participle of the Italian verb 'spendere'. It agrees in gender and number with the noun it modifies.

readability_explanation.text: 'Speso' is an Italian word meaning 'spent' or 'used up.' It is the past participle of the verb 'spendere' (to spend). It is used to describe something that has been used or consumed.  It needs to agree in gender and number with the noun it modifies, so you'll also see 'spesa,' 'spesi,' and 'spese.'

example_sentences.sentence: Il tempo è stato speso bene.
I soldi sono stati spesi per la casa.
example_sentences.translation: The money was spent on the house.
